Â Â Â Â Â  i don't see how you couldn't

Â Â Â Â Â  i can use varying numbers of words. sometimes i get a kick out of just, using a real weird number of words

Â Â Â Â Â  that's almost the only songwriting technique i know

Â Â Â Â Â  it's impossible to be smart. if you can do it, then you've done the impossible, and are thus extremely smart

Â Â Â Â Â  maybe like 2 minute warning or something like that

Â Â Â Â Â  hi

Â Â Â Â Â  there's no reason they couldn't make sense, but i don't know which ones you're referring to

7.7.25  12:48 pm   Have you always been this good at explaining yourself. Many times when you answer questions i get the feeling that you've thought a lot and found a way to say what you really think, not prohibited by any mental barrier.

Â Â Â Â Â  good communication is essential for my life's work. i've been working on it for a long time, probably motivated by all the times when it fails so miserably

7.7.25  12:03 pm   what do you think of the number 2,912,122,321,182,026 

Â Â Â Â Â  according to my calculations that is an integer

7.7.25  11:49 am   If I sleep through breakfast and wake up at lunchtime should I make myself lunch or breakfast?

Â Â Â Â Â  said the inventor of brunch

7.7.25  6:59 am   Can  all questions be answered? Should all questions be answered?

Â Â Â Â Â  all questions are answerable, usually in multiple ways, but they can also remain unanswered if desired

7.7.25  6:13 am   What's a belief you hold that most people would find absurd?

Â Â Â Â Â  "i dont hold any beliefs that most people would find absurd"

7.7.25  4:56 am   "People forgot how to wear socks but still bake clouds with a spoon made of eyelash dust. The government issues permission slips to sneeze on Tuesdays, and the moon occasionally forgets it's made of cheese, causing mild traffic jams in the sky. Meanwhile, existential vending machines only accept compliments as currency, but nobody remembers how to give one except the town's one-legged cactus who speaks in Morse code. Our protagonist has to cope with it."
Hi Bill, do you think this is a good novel idea?

Â Â Â Â Â  it's an idea of what an idea is probably supposed to sound like

7.7.25  4:43 am   Since I can't wash Canada because it's already clean, how can I spend my evening in Canada with soap?

Â Â Â Â Â  take selfies with soap. let the soap take selfies with you

7.7.25  3:39 am   what's your favorite word starting with a vowel?

Â Â Â Â Â  a

7.7.25  2:41 am   hi bill, i read your answer to a question about chord progressions a few weeks ago where you said you don't like that phrase, since it tricks people into thinking it's something much more than it is. is there another way or term you think is more useful to understand patterns of chords? i'm very curious about how you think about this, your music makes me feel uniquely groovy, and i think the chords you choose and the way you use/break patterns are a big reason why i enjoy it so much

Â Â Â Â Â  there's no way to describe what chords do. the more songs you get to know, the more things you try out for yourself, the more familiar (and curious!) you will continue to get, and, just like recognizing faces, you'll be fully equipped to play the game to the fullest but you still will never be able to pin down exactly what works and why. and this becomes a more and more shocking revelation the more experienced you get, because, despite all that experience, you're thinking "how could i, the expert, still not be able to pin this down?" until you realize, ..... the music, just like a mischievous child, actually takes personal thrills in unpindownableness. and in fact so does the listener

7.7.25  2:35 am   if you made a sandwich, what would you put in it

Â Â Â Â Â  hear me out...... a sandwich

7.7.25  2:34 am   How do I learn to look far away?

Â Â Â Â Â  first you have to understand what's close to you, so you know exactly what to tune out

Â Â Â Â Â  i'm not so sure about that

Â Â Â Â Â  everything is treasure

7.6.25  11:26 pm   how is it that these sounds, these patterns of noises, have the power to make me feel practically anything. It doesn't seem that evolutionary advantageous. It also doesn't seem to be something learned. I just don't know.

Â Â Â Â Â  you'd have to admit, 1+1 equalling 2 is not particularly evolutionarily advantageous either, but here we are

7.6.25  10:20 pm   Opinion on birds?

Â Â Â Â Â  they usually can't move their eyes. so that's why their whole head moves like eyes, with eyelike precision

7.6.25  10:06 pm   what have you learned recently?

Â Â Â Â Â  i'm an idiot

7.6.25  6:09 pm   The fact that our gut reactions are often wrong yet we still have to rely on them all the time is an uncomfortable dilemma for me.

Â Â Â Â Â  to be fair, sometimes those will be much better quality reasoning. fresher, more alive. i'm not saying it's always better, but at least some of the time it's better. And it's also good news for more diligent reasoning, because when there's a time constraint it naturally gives your thinking a workout and makes it stronger. so this is really a win win. Once in a while you can take your sweet forever to think something through, but that can be hit or miss at best

7.6.25  5:08 pm   what is your opinion on the number 1?

Â Â Â Â Â  it's pretty good

7.6.25  4:18 pm   can you give me a hyperlink to something random? thanks.

Â Â Â Â Â  ok. this number will either be 1 or 2 but i can't predict which

Â Â Â Â Â  ah that would of course be the art of artform banishment

7.6.25  10:54 am   thoughts on the kalimba as an instrument? i think it makes some very cozy and relaxing sounds

Â Â Â Â Â  i would agree with that. also its basic mechanics should probably be familiar to keyboard players

7.6.25  8:30 am   my friends having hot chips and one specific chip is bigger than all the other chips, how does this affect the timeline me and my friend are currently in?

Â Â Â Â Â  it gives you something fun to notice, and talk about together, thus strengthening your friendship and creating another one of many fond memories to share

Â Â Â Â Â  no

7.6.25  5:16 am   do you ever feel reinvigorated and type uppercase letters

Â Â Â Â Â  yes, that happens all the time

7.6.25  4:32 am   do you have a least favourite english language inconsistency?

Â Â Â Â Â  no

7.6.25  4:12 am   could you recommend a book that once made a lasting impression on you? it doesn't need to be a good impression, just an impression.

Â Â Â Â Â  some of the most lasting impressions were made by books i've never read. Like in ghost stories, some of the most vivid scenes are the ones where you don't even get to see the ghost. your imagination does the work. so in that same way, some of the books that make the most powerful impression are the ones where i've only imagined what i think they could be like. so in that case i would have a hard time recommending them
